intro: Eschweilera pedicellata, commonly known as the pink orchid, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a rosette of broad, waxy leaves that form a central cup, which collects rainwater. Eschweilera pedicellata is often found growing on trees, epiphytically, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its unique appearance makes it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
